intro: Lycianthes lycioides var. brachyphylla, commonly known as the short-stemmed bitterleaf, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshade plants, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that give way to oval, orange-red berries containing several seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and pharmacological studies.
